alert.note: Alert for Baker; Northern Columbia; Southern Columbia; Union (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 06 at 8:31PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Baker, Union, southeastern Columbia and south central Charlton Counties through 900 PM EDT... At 831 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Taylor to Columbia. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph, pea size hail, and excessive cloud-to-ground lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Excessive cloud-to-ground lightning is occurring. Locations impacted include... Lake Butler, Taylor, Glen St. Mary, Worthington Springs, Palestine Community, Groves, Providence, Olustee, Upland Pines and Watertown. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for northern and northeastern Florida...and southeastern Georgia.

area.areaDesc: Baker; Northern Columbia; Southern Columbia; Union
